Authors: Yusriski R., Astuti B., Ilham M., Zahedi
Title: Integrated Batch Production and Multiple Preventive Maintenance Scheduling on A Single Machine to Minimize Total Actual Flow Time
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Materials Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Department of Industrial Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Universitas Jenderal Achmad Yani (UNJANI), PO. BOX 807, Bandung, Indonesia; Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yusriski, R., Department of Industrial Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Universitas Jenderal Achmad Yani (UNJANI), PO. BOX 807, Bandung, Indonesia; Astuti, B., Department of Industrial Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Universitas Jenderal Achmad Yani (UNJANI), PO. BOX 807, Bandung, Indonesia; Ilham, M., Department of Industrial Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Universitas Jenderal Achmad Yani (UNJANI), PO. BOX 807, Bandung, Indonesia; Zahedi, Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: We discuss the problem of batch production and multiple preventive maintenance (PM) scheduling on a single machine. On batch production systems, there is a situation that PM activity should be executed at the time when the machine is processing the parts on a batch. Delaying that action could cause an increase in the possibility of a rejected product. However, applying the PM action would interrupt the process and also need an additional setup when starting the process again. It could impact the longer total flow time. This research proposed two algorithms (the optimal and the heuristic algorithm) which integrated both of batch production and multiple preventive maintenance schedules. The performance of the algorithm measured by minimizes the total actual flow time. Experimental results show that the effectivity of the heuristic algorithm is between 66% until 100% from the optimal algorithm. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Heuristic algorithms; Optimization; Risk management; Scheduling; Scheduling algorithms; Systems engineering; Batch production; Flow-time; Optimal algorithm; Preventive maintenance (pm); Single- machines; Total flowtime; Preventive maintenance

Authors: Zahedi Z., Salim A., Yusriski R., Haris H.
Title: Optimization of an integrated batch production and maintenance scheduling on flow shop with two machines
Source title: International Journal of Industrial Engineering Computations
Affiliations: Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Industrial Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Jendral Ahmad Yani University (UNJANI), Gatot Subroto Street, Bandung, 40285, Indonesia; Trisakti School of Transportation Management, IPN Kebon Nanas Street, Jakarta, 13410, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Zahedi, Z., Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Salim, A., Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yusriski, R., Department of Industrial Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Jendral Ahmad Yani University (UNJANI), Gatot Subroto Street, Bandung, 40285, Indonesia; Haris, H., Trisakti School of Transportation Management, IPN Kebon Nanas Street, Jakarta, 13410, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper discusses an integrated model of batch production and maintenance scheduling on flow shop with two deteriorating machines producing single item to be delivered at a due date. The model describes the trade-off between production and maintenance costs as the production run length increases on two machines. The objective function of the model is to minimize the total cost consisting of in process and completed part inventory costs, setup costs, preventive & corrective maintenance costs and rework costs on two machines. The step-wise optimization algorithm is developed to solve a mixed integer quadratic programming. Comparison with the practice and the model sensitivity analysis are demonstrated to clarify how the algorithm works. © 2019 by the authors; licensee Growing Science, Canada.
Author Keywords: Batch production; Flow shop; Machine maintenance; Two machines

Title: Stepwise Optimization for Model of Integrated Batch Production and Maintenance Scheduling for Single Item Processed on Flow Shop with Two Machines in JIT Environment
Affiliations: Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Engineering, Jendral Ahmad Yani University (UNJANI), Gatot Subroto Street, Bandung, 40285, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Zahedi, Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rojali, Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yusriski, R., Faculty of Engineering, Jendral Ahmad Yani University (UNJANI), Gatot Subroto Street, Bandung, 40285, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper elaborates an integrated model of batch production scheduling and maintenance scheduling on flow shop with two machines producing single item to be delivered at a common due date. The objective function of the model is to minimize total cost consisting of in process and completed part inventory costs, setup costs, preventive and corrective maintenance costs and rework cost on two machines. The Model was a mixed integer quadratic that contains some integer and binary variables, so that analytic search solution could not be used for the model. It was developed a stepwise optimization method to solve the model. This model describes the trade-off between production cost and maintenance cost as the increasing of production run length on two machines. An example is given to clarify how the model solved. © 2017 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: batch production; machine maintenance; stepwise optimization; two machines flow shop
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Costs; Economic and social effects; Machine shop practice; Preventive maintenance; Production control; Scheduling; Scheduling algorithms; Batch production; Flow-shops; Integrated modeling; Machine maintenance; Maintenance scheduling; Objective functions; Preventive and corrective maintenance; Stepwise optimization; Maintenance

Authors: Zahedi Z., Ari Samadhi T.M.A., Suprayogi S., Halim A.H.
Title: Integrated batch production and maintenance scheduling for multiple items processed on a deteriorating machine to minimize total production and maintenance costs with due date constraint
Source title: International Journal of Industrial Engineering Computations
Affiliations: Bandung Institute of Technology, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Industrial Engineering and Management, Bandung Institute of Technology, Ganesha Street 10, Bandung, 40132, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Zahedi, Z., Bandung Institute of Technology, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ari Samadhi, T.M.A., Department of Industrial Engineering and Management, Bandung Institute of Technology, Ganesha Street 10, Bandung, 40132, Indonesia; Suprayogi, S., Department of Industrial Engineering and Management, Bandung Institute of Technology, Ganesha Street 10, Bandung, 40132, Indonesia; Halim, A.H., Department of Industrial Engineering and Management, Bandung Institute of Technology, Ganesha Street 10, Bandung, 40132, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper discusses an integrated model of batch production and maintenance scheduling on a deteriorating machine producing multiple items to be delivered at a common due date. The model describes the trade-off between total inventory cost and maintenance cost as the increase of production run length. The production run length is a time bucket between two consecutive preventive maintenance activities. The objective function of the model is to minimize total cost consisting of in process and completed part inventory costs, setup cost, preventive and corrective maintenance costs and rework cost. The problem is to determine the optimal production run length and to schedule the batches obtained from determining the production run length in order to minimize total cost. © 2016 Growing Science Ltd. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Batch production; Machine maintenance; Multiple items
